bibl.title: Letter from Wickliffe Rose to Henry Rose Carter, February 19, 1921

div1.p: Rose writes that he is awaiting Carter's report on yellow fever in Peru. He offers further funds and assistance.

div1.head: Letter from Wickliffe Rose to Henry Rose Carter, February 19, 1921

February 19, 1921
Dear Doctor Carter:
div1.p:
This will acknowledge the receipt this morn-
ing of the following cable:

JUST ARRIVED FROM INFECTED DISTRICT WILL
ADVISE

It is a great comfort to me to know that you
are on the ground in Peru much as I regret the necessity
for your remaining longer. I know you were anxious to
get back to this country. I am eagerly awaiting your
reports of the yellow fever situation. Nothing could
give me greater confidence than to know that you are
on hand to take care of it.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, Wickliffe Rose. Doctor Henry R. Carter
Care American Consulate
Lima, Peru
WRR:HJP
P.S. If you should need additional funds or our assistance
in any form, let us know.
W.R.
